current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To improve the examination of depository institutions,
		  and for other purposes.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban
			 Affairs

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Financial Institutions Examination
			 Fairness and Reform Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Act of 1978
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Act of 1978
usc/12/3301/etseq

text.#text:
A Federal financial institutions regulatory
				agency shall provide a final examination report to a financial institution not
				later than 60 days after the later of—

the exit interview
				for an examination of the institution; or

the provision of
				additional information by the institution relating to the examination.

If a financial institution is not subject to a resident
				examiner program, the exit interview shall occur not later than the end of the
				9-month period beginning on the commencement of the examination, except that
				such period may be extended by the Federal financial institutions regulatory
				agency by providing written notice to the institution and the Office of
				Examination Ombudsman describing with particularity the reasons that a longer
				period is needed to complete the examination.

Upon the request of
				a financial institution, the Federal financial institutions regulatory agency
				shall include with the final report under this section an appendix listing all
				examination or other factual information relied upon by the agency in support
				of a material supervisory
				determination.
The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, as
			 amended by this Act, is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Federal Financial
			 Institutions Examination Council Act of 1978
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Act of 1978
usc/12/3301/etseq

text.#text:
In the examination of
				financial institutions—

a modified or
				restructured commercial loan shall be removed from non-accrual status if the
				borrower demonstrates the ability to perform on such loan over a maximum period
				of 6 months, except that with respect to loans on a quarterly, semiannual, or
				longer repayment schedule such period shall be a maximum of 3 consecutive
				repayment periods;

a new appraisal on
				a performing commercial loan shall not be required unless an advance of new
				funds is involved; and

in classifying a commercial loan in which
				there has been deterioration in collateral value, the amount to be classified
				shall be the portion of the deficiency relating to the decline in collateral
				value and repayment capacity of the borrower.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Act of 1978/s:1013/ss:a

text.#text:
The Federal
				financial institutions regulatory agencies may not require a financial
				institution that is well capitalized to raise additional capital in lieu of an
				action prohibited under

The Federal
				financial institutions regulatory agencies shall develop and apply identical
				definitions and reporting requirements for non-accrual
				loans.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Act of 1978
usc/12/3301/etseq

header.#text:
Right to appeal
			 before an independent administrative law judge

Right to
				appeal before an independent administrative law judge

text.#text:
A financial
				institution shall have the right to appeal a material supervisory determination
				contained in a final report of examination.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
within 60 days after receiving the final report or
				examination that is the subject of such appeal.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Office of Examination Ombudsman

text.#text:
A
				financial institution seeking an appeal under this section shall file a written
				notice with the

The written notice shall identify the material
				supervisory determination that is the subject of the appeal, and a statement of
				the reasons why the institution believes that the determination is incorrect or
				should otherwise be modified.

Any information relied upon by the
				agency in the final report that is not in the possession of the financial
				institution may be requested by the financial institution and shall be
				delivered promptly by the agency to the financial institution.

header.#text:
Information to
				be provided to institution

Hearing before
				independent administrative law judge

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall determine the merits of the appeal on
				the record, after an opportunity for a hearing before an independent
				administrative law judge.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Office of Examination Ombudsman

text.#text: The

If a hearing is requested by the financial
				institution, the hearing shall—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Office of Examination Ombudsman

text.#text:
take place not
				later than 60 days after the notice of the appeal was received by the

be conducted
				pursuant to the procedures set forth under

In any hearing under this
				subsection—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
what determination should be made;
				and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Office of Examination Ombudsman

text.#text:
the administrative
				law judge shall recommend to the

in making such recommendation, the
				administrative law judge shall not defer to the opinions of the examiner or
				agency, but shall independently determine the appropriateness of the agency’s
				decision based upon the relevant statutes, regulations, and other appropriate
				guidance.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
on an appeal under this
				section shall—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Office of Examination Ombudsman

text.#text: A decision by the

be made not later than 60 days after the
				record has been closed; and

be final agency action, and shall bind the
				agency whose supervisory determination was the subject of the appeal and the
				financial institution making the appeal.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Office of Examination Ombudsman

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
on actions taken on
				appeals under this section, including the types of issues that financial
				institutions have appealed and the results of those appeals. In no case shall
				such a report contain information about individual financial institutions or
				any confidential or privileged information shared by financial
				institutions.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee
				on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate

text.#text: The

A Federal
				financial institutions regulatory agency may not—

retaliate against
				a financial institution, including service providers, or any
				institution-affiliated party, for exercising appellate rights under this
				section; or

delay or deny any
				agency action that would benefit a financial institution or any
				institution-affiliated party on the basis that an appeal under this section is
				pending under this
				section.
